results.title: Australian Aborigines: cooking
results.creator_credit: A.P. Elkin and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Taken during the University of Sydney’s expedition to Arnhem Land, this film shows the traditional methods the local people use to cook food.

results.title: A Conversation with Jawaharlal Nehru and Chester Bowles
results.creator_credit: Robert D. Graff and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: The Prime Minister of India, statesman and leader of the awakening nations of Asia - discusses his career and world events with Chester Bowles, former US Ambassador to India. He describes his early life, his friendship with Gandhi, and the fight for freedom. he also expresses his views on the problems India was facing in the 1960’s.

results.title: A Conversation with B.F. Skinner (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Peter Jordan, CRM Educational Films and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: In his book Beyond Freedom and Dignity, Dr. B. F. Skinner rejects the general belief that within each individual there is an “inner man” immune to environmental shaping. In discussion with Elizabeth Hall of Psychology Today magazine, he illuminates the origins of behaviorism and some of its basic principles and argues the need for a culture designed by behaviorists. Within this context, he explores the notion of control, its use and potential misuse, punishment and freedom.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Jordan, CRM Educational Films and McGraw-Hill Films

results.title: Conversation
results.creator_credit: Centron Productions and Young America Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speech”.
Demonstrates and explains how conversation (informal speech) reaches into every phase of our everyday life; that is our surest way of making or losing friends, of being hired or fired. Through dramatic incidents, the film illustrates some important do’s and don’ts in social and business conversation, and indicates effective speech techniques to use.

results.title: Controversy over the moon
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents the controversy concerning the geological make-up of the moon - specifically the origin of large lunar craters. Two eminent scientists interpret the same available data and discuss reasons for their divergent views. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Controversy over industrial pollution: a case study
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Luther Gerlach
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Environment in Crisis”.
Anaconda Aluminium Company opened a plant at Columbia Falls, Montana. In 1968, after a plant explosion, poisonous fluoride emissions began to damage trees for miles around. All sides of the resulting controversy are presented objectively in this film,which should spark discussion of the environmental crisis in general and of the scientific, social and economic issues involved in finding solutions to pollution problems

results.title: Controlling stocks
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Management Techniques”.
One of a series of films about some of the problems of forecasting, and of trying to achieve control through forecasts, particularly in the case of small and medium-sized firms. Carrying excessive stocks can be expensive, whilst insufficient stocks may cause loss of customer confidence. Shows how to strike a reasonable balance of stock holdings.

results.title: Controlling quality is everybody's business
results.creator_credit: Wallace J. Richardson and Industrial Education Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the need for a sound working knowledge of the principles of effective quality control, and how these may be applied. The film also dramatises the importance of maintaining good quality, and shows how everyone can help.

results.title: Controlling behavior through reinforcement
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology”.
Schedules of conditioning thorugh reinforcement are illustrated with pigeons in Skinner apparatus and their applications to human behaviour are indicated. Demonstrates the effects of: (1) fixed rate reinforcement which results in a high work output; (2) variable intervals resulting in the falling off of output; (3) variable interval reinforcement which causes continuous output at a high rate and persists after reinforcement discontinues.

results.title: Controlling absenteeism
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Effective Supervisor Series”.
Focuses on the causes of absenteeism in business and offers practical solutions. Identifies five categories of absentees and provides supervisors with coping strategies and tactics to avoid in dealing with staff.
